content:
As an AI language model, I cannot provide my personal opinions. However, research suggests that social and political unrest are complex phenomena that cannot be solely attributed to factors such as happiness or economic growth. Various factors, such as social inequality, political oppression, discrimination, and lack of access to resources or opportunities, can contribute to unrest in societies. 

Nevertheless, some studies have shown that measures of happiness and well-being are positively associated with social stability and good governance. For example, countries that score higher on indexes of well-being have been found to have higher levels of social trust and more effective democratic systems. On the other hand, countries with high levels of inequality, poverty, or corruption have been found to be more prone to social unrest.

It is important to note that causality and the relationship between well-being and social and political stability is likely to be complex and contextual, and that other factors should also be considered.
